reviews.review_msg: Her slides are very boring. She goes way too fast and will skip over the breaks if she feels like it. She does not provide practice questions, and relies entirely on the Teaching Assistants to teach the course. She'll fly through the important lecture content. You can do well in her course by attending tutorials and doing the readings.
Hasina is a very nice professor, however I don't think she taught very well, and the material seemed fairly easy for a 400 level course. There was a lot of group work and she marks really hard.

Hasina is an amazing professor! The class was not totally easy, but she is extremely approachable for help and gives really good feedback. A lot of memorization of the lecture slides and readings is needed for the exam, but overall the class was really enjoyable and I would definitely take a class with her again.

Everything in this class was self-taught - A LOT OF INFO. Her lecture slides are very repetitive and the colours make them hard to read. One assignment worth 20% and midterm and final both worth 30%. Reading the text and doing the practice qs are necessary for passing. Not available for extra help and will not answer ANY questions during exams.

Dr. Samji is an excellent professor who is thoroughly knowledgeable about epidemiology. Her tests are fair and based off of the textbook. Would recommend familiarizing oneself with end of chapter questions.  The class average was a B so I wouldn't say it was too hard of a class.
worst prof at sfu not willing to help you in office hours and tests are ridicously long ! when asking for help she just tells you your question again without any clarification AVOID
hard prof who is not consistent with her marking since there are only exams and homework which accounts for your grade. never shows up to office hours on time and is unprepared. AVOID !

hands done one of the best profs at SFU ! she makes understanding stats epidemiology a breeze. Her midterm was quite lengthy but if you know her powerpoint slides in and out and do the readings and qs in the readings you're good to go ! she doesn't try to trick you as some of the q's were pulled out from the text. scales heavily for exams !
